p: Dichloromethane, n-hexane, chloroform, ethyl acetate, and methanol were used to prepare various extracts of the plants; Cinnamomum zeylanicum, Crataegus oxyacantha, Hibiscus sabdariffa, Morus alba, Portulaca oleracea, Rubus fruticosus, Syzygium aromaticum, Teucrium polium, Trigonella foenum-graecum and Vaccinium arctostaphylos were tested for their inhibition of α-glucosidase, α-amylase, and antioxidant activity [ 163]. S. aromaticum methanolic extract exerted the highest inhibitory effect against both α-glucosidase and α-amylase enzymes. Previously, the aqueous extracts were reported to have insulin-like effects, such as increasing glucose uptake into adipocytes. Among the other analyzed plants, C. zeylanicum, H. sabdariffa, R. fruticous, C. oxyacantha, V. arctostaphylos, and M. alba exhibited strong inhibitory activities against α-glucosidase in comparison with the reference drug, acarbose [ 164].
